newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian workers not satisfied with sex-aid wages.
newsitem.headline: Russian workers not satisfied with sex-aid wages.

text.p: Bosses at what was once a high-tech Soviet defence plant have solved a severe cash shortage by paying workers with handouts of the firm's new post-Cold War products -- which include rubber sex aids.

Employees at the Akhtuba factory in Volgograd, who have had no wages for over a year, are far from satisfied with being paid in dildos and are now on the brink of revolt, the Moscow Times newspaper said at the weekend.
"We're on the verge of a strike to end this insulting situation," chief shop steward Tamara Lozhintseva said.
The Akhtuba plant had previously made high-precision marine navigation instruments for the Soviet navy.
Huge backlogs of unpaid bills bedevil Russian industry. Many firms blame the state for not paying its debts. The government accuses big business of evading its taxes.
The workers, caught in the middle, often end up with nothing.
